result.execSummary:
All charges against Dylan J Worden in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dylan J Worden is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Worden, Dylan J

records.addlTxt: Motion Hearing set for 07/19/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Arraignment and Pre-Trial Conference set for 08/22/22 - not deliverable as addressed

Defendant Dylan J Worden in court, in custody.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Dylan J Worden.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case heard at this time is 22CF-234.
In addition 20CF-334, 21CF-61, 21CF-106, 21CF-116, 21CF-132, 21CF-285, 21CF-417, 22CF-154, 22CF-158, 22CF-161, 22CF-162, 22CF-165 and 22CM-112 are called.

3:07 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances. 

There are a couple motions in 22CF-234, that will be addressed at this time.
In 20CF-247, Atty Robert Gardner represents Defendant, was previously privately retained.

BY THE COURT:
Court will then not call 20CF-247, for Atty Gardner is not present today.

Court reviews the motions. 
State has not filed any response.

Atty Weiland addresses the Court.
Motion to request the Court to reconsider finding probable cause is addressed first.
Atty Weiland argues for the motion at this time, requests the Court to dismiss this case.
Court reviews the transcript from the preliminary hearing.
Atty Dodge replies, requests the Court to bind over for trial.
Atty Weiland replies.

Court addresses the parties. 

BY THE COURT:
Court reverses itself.
Court grants motion to reconsider and will not bind over in 22CF-234. This is essentially a dismissal.

Court will leave it up to the State how to wish to pursue this.
State intends to refile the charges.

State moves to dismiss 22CF-234.

BY THE COURT:
22CF-234 is dismissed.

Motion to address bond is next.
Court wants to address bond in all the remaining files.

Atty Weiland addresses the Court regarding bond modification in all remaining files referred to. 
State requests that the $7,500 cash bond in 22CF-234 continue but be put in one of the other open cases. 

BY THE COURT:
Court orders $7,500 cash bond with conditions previously stated, in the remaining 13 bonds. (all but for 22CF-234 and 20CF-247)

($7,500 cash bond covers all 13 bonds).

BY THE COURT:
Scheduling conference to bet set for August 8th at 10 am, for the 14 cases.  Trials will be set.
Motion hearing on July 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Motion Requesting Reconsideration of Finding Probable Cause filed by Atty William Weiland (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 07/11/22 sp)
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing held on June 6, 2022
Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification. Filed by Atty Weiland.
Motion hearing on July 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter from the Defendant in re:  Evidentiary Hearing, Bill of Particulars and Order to Dismiss
Order to Bind Over for Trial /s/ PB 06/20/22
Matter set for an Arraignment on 08/22/2022 at 11:00 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

4:06 PM Atty Weiland requests bond amendment in 22CF234 down to a signature bond.
ADA Dodge states objections to the request for bond modification.
BY THE COURT:  Bond modification is denied.

3:05 PM 22CF234 Preliminary Hearing
ADA Dodge calls Sgt. Kontos who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Judicial Notice is taken by the Court of Portage County cases 20CF247, 21CF106, 21CF61, 20CF334, 21CF116, 21CF132, 21CF285, 21CF417, 22CF154, 22CF158, and 22CF162..
No cross exam.
ADA Dodge's argument is heard.
Atty Weiland's argument is heard.
BY THE COURT:
Court reserves right to determine probable cause until the court can review today's hearing transcript.

3:16 PM 22CF154 Preliminary Hearing:
ADA Dodge calls Sgt Ballew who is sworn in and testifies during exam.
Witness identifies the defendant in court.
Court takes Judicial Notice the the defendant was on bond in 20CF247.
Cross exam by Atty Weiland.
ADA Dodge's argument is heard.
Atty Weiland's argument is heard.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

3:27 PM 22CF162 Preliminary Hearing
ADA Dodge calls Officer Stanton who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Court takes Judicial Notice the the defendant was on bond in 20CF247.
ADA Dodge's argument is heard.
Atty Weiland's argument is heard.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

3:34 PM Cases 22CF158 and 22CF161 Preliminary Hearing
ADA Dodge calls Detective Porter who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam
Court takes Judicial Notice the the defendant was on bond in 20CF247.
No cross exam.
No further arguments.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

3:57 PM Case 22CF165 Preliminary Hearing
Witness identifies the defendant in court.
Court takes Judicial Notice the the defendant was on bond in 20CF247.
No cross exam.
No further arguments.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

All cases set PTC.
22CF234 will need an Arraignment Hearing.

3:00 PM Defendant Dylan J Worden in court, in custody.  Attorney (Atty) William George Weiland in court for Dylan J Worden.  District Assistant Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF154, 22CF158, 22CF161, 22CF162, 22CF164- Preliminary/Arraignments) 22CF234 and 22CM112 initial appearances first.

22CM112 Initial appearance:
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

22CF234 Initial Appearance then all the felony cases on the calendar today will have a preliminary hearing in each case.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Arraignment scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: William Weiland
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Dylan J Worden not in court.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard are 22CF-234 and 22CM-112.

2:43 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matters are to be rescheduled to track with other hearings at June 6th at 3 pm.

Zoom is open and running but Waupaca has not opted in. 

2:44 PM Dylan Worden now appears on Zoom, in custody, Waupaca County Jail.

Court informs Defendant of charges in 22CF-234.
Defendant has received a copy of the complaint.
Defendant does not have counsel right now but does so in his other cases.
Defendant has been trying to get ahold of Atty Weiland.

Court will adjourn this initial appearance.
Atty Dodge will have legal associate set up so Defendant will appear in person.
Defendant addresses the Court regarding the request for bond modification.
Court replies.

Judicial Assistant will reach out to Atty Weiland indicating that Defendant needs copies of complaints.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for May 31, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess/consume illegal controlled substances.
Follow all open bonds.

1:07 PM Defendant Dylan J Worden appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Dylan J Worden. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping, Possession of Methamphetamine. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
No victims are present. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments and requests a signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
